utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Guys, hurry up! The flight leaves in four hours! It could take time to get a taxi! There could be traffic! The plane could leave early! When we get to London, there could be a line at customs! Come on!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Six-hour trip to London. That’s a lot of Monica.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Passport, check! Camera, check! Traveller’s cheques, check!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Who are you saying "check" too?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Myself. Y’know for remembering to pack a thing. Yeah, you do a good thing, you get a check! My mom does it, I never realized it was weird.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, my mom used to put her head in the oven. Well, actually, she only did it the one time. But it was pretty weird.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey! Are you ready yet?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yep! You got the tickets?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh! Got ‘em right here, check!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: It’s all London, baby! Here we go.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You got your passport?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, in my third drawer on my dresser. You don’t want to lose that.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ohh!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: There it is.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, if you need the vacuum, it’s in my closet on the left-hand side. Ah, the garbage bags are next to the refrigerator…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, okay, but Rachel’s gonna be here too, can’t I just ask her this stuff?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, okay, give that a try!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right! Let’s do it!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Woo-hoo!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, cheerie-o!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: London baby!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, ‘cause that’s not gonna get annoying.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: London baby!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, y’know what? I was wrong.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, we’re all here! I guess we should get going!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ohhh, I wanna come over there and give you a hug and wish you luck on your wedding, but I don’t—can’t get up.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, I’ll-I’ll come hug you.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Great! Yeah, could you bring me the newspaper?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, have a great wedding!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, hey, Chandler I wanna hug you too!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, and great! You might as well bring me my book, it’s on the counter in your apartment.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So, we’re off.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Have fun!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Thanks! Ugh, I can’t believe you’re not gonna be there!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, I know.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So-so come! Why don’t you come?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: To London! Come to London. Please? It’ll mean so much to me.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, well, I gotta work, I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Why-why can’t you take a couple of days off?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Because, I can’t! Ross, I told you, no. I can’t.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: This is my wedding.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: All right, y’know what? We really are late! Let’s go! Let’s go! Let’s go!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Fine. You’ll-you’ll watch it on video when we get back.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Here you go Phoebe! Here you go Phobo! Phewbedo! Phaybobo.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: All right, let’s go! Bye, Pheebs!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Bye, Pheebs!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: London baby!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, do you need a hug? You don’t have to bring me anything!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Come on! Do something!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I am, I’m ignoring you.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay, here! I wanna be the on camera guy. All right, first stop, Westminster Abbey.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, what the hell is that?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: It’s London, baby! All right, the hotel’s here. Wait. No, we wanna go… No. I know. I’m gonna have to go into the map.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, if you see a little version of me in there? Kill it!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I got it! Here we go.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay. Listen-listen, we’re not gonna have to walk this way the entire time are we?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Shhh! Man, you made me lose it!

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: …and that was all before 10 o’clock. The caterer rang and said it was going to be Chicken Kiev instead of Chicken Tarragon. And then the florist phoned to say there aren’t any tulips. Oh, and the chilliest has carpel-tunel syndrome. We’re not gonna be…

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Whoa-whoa-whoa! Emily, honey, okay?

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Well, up yours too!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?! No! No! That’s-that’s time-out!

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Sweetie, you gotta relax. Everything’s gonna be great, okay? Come on. Come on.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Chicken Kiev?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Um-hmm! Doesn’t that sound delicious at the last minute?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, y’know, but something like salmon which would be so much more elegant than the chicken. And, you wouldn’t have to worry about the salmonella. So, I can’t wait to see this place you’re getting married!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah. Yes, this place is beautiful. Emily’s parents got married here.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: I still can’t believe they’re tearing it down. It really is the most lovely building you’ll ever see. I mean it’s over… Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It’s nice.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Oh. Oh.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Oh. Oh my God. How can this be happening? What are we going to do?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It’s all right! Everything’s gonna be all right.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: How’s it gonna be all right?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh-huh, I see that.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, I talked to the guy with the shovel and I found out what happened.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What? What?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: They torn it down a few days early.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right! Westminster Abbey! Hands down, best Abbey I’ve ever seen. Hey! Okay. What do you think of the Abbey, Chandler?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I think it’s great. It’s great. Y’know, they’re thinking of changing the name of this place.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Really? To what?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: To Put the Camera Away!!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Man, you are Westminster Crabby.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh. Oh.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, honey! Don’t get up! What do you need?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, no. Oh, nothing.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Come on! I am here to take care of you! What do you need? Anything.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, I have a wedgie.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, that is all you.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: So-so, what do you want for lunch?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, I don’t know. I guess we have to eat.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, I do. What’s the matter?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I’m just bummed about the way I left things with Ross. I shouldn’t have lied to him about having to work. He seemed so mad at me.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Eh, don’t be so hard on yourself. If someone I was still in love with was getting married…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Still in love with?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I’m not in love with Ross!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh. No. No. Good! Yeah, me neither.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Phoebe, I’m going to Ross’s wedding because he is my ex-boyfriend and that would be really uncomfortable. Not because, I’m still in love with him! I mean, hey, y’know, I like Ross as much as the next guy, y’know? Clearly I have feelings for him, but feelings don’t mean love! I mean, I still have loving feelings for Ross. Yeah! But, I have, I have continuing feelings of love, but that doesn’t mean that-that I’m still in love with him. Y’know? I-I have sexual feelings for him, but I do love him—Ohh! Oh my God! Oh my—why didn’t you tell me?!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: We thought you knew!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: We?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, we all know! We talk about it all the time!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You all know? Does Ross know?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh no, Ross doesn’t know anything.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, I can not believe you didn’t tell me!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, because we thought you knew!! It’s so obvious! God, that would be like telling Monica, "Hey, you like things clean."

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: The Vendor
utterance.content: So, what are you guys in the market for? We’ve got uh, scarves, tulip post cards...

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Check this out? Huh? Yeah. That’s the stuff. What do you think?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, I don’t have to buy that, "I’m with stupid" T-shirt anymore.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, I like it. Here you go.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right, look, you’re not really gonna buy that are you? Don’t you think you’ve embarrassed me enough for one day?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, I embarrass you?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: How can I answer that when I’m pretending I don’t know you?

utterance.speaker: The Vendor
utterance.content: He’s just jealous. You’ll fit right in; all Londoners wear them!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh really? Then how come no one here is wearing them?

utterance.speaker: The Vendor
utterance.content: They’re all tourists.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right, look, if you insist on wearing that, in public, y’know, you’re gonna spend the rest of the afternoon all by yourself.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh yeah? If you’re gonna make me choose between you and the hat? I choose the hat.

utterance.speaker: The Vendor
utterance.content: Good choice.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, wait. All right, that’s it, okay, I’m out of here. I am not going to be embarrassed anymore!

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey! I just spoke to your dad, and you know what? He seems to think we’ll be able to find a new place for the wedding.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: We don’t have to.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Whoa-whoa-what? You found a place?

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: No. But, Monica and I were talking, and-and I was so upset about the hall being knocked down, and she suggested that we put the wedding off for a bit.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: She said what?

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: She said, "If I’m not gonna be happy getting married somewhere that we find in a day, well then we should just postpone it."

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Postpone it? Emily, do you think Monica realises how much our parents spent on this wedding? Do you my sister’s teeny-tiny little brain comprehends that people took time out of their lives to fly thousands of miles to be here, huh? This isn’t right.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: I realize that people are going to be disappointed. But, I’m sure they’ll come back when we can do it right.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I can’t ask people to do that? Would you ask people to do that?

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Don’t you point your pants at me! We have no choice! Anywhere that’s half-decent would’ve be booked months ago, Ross don’t you understand? This is our wedding I’m talking about.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: The only thing I understand is; postponing it is not an option. This is when we’re getting married.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: So what are you saying? It’s now or never?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No. I’m saying it’s now.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Or?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: There’s no ‘or’ in mind. What is wrong with these pants?!!

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: It’s not the pants. It’s you that is backwards. And if, and if you don’t understand how important this is to me, well then, perhaps we shouldn’t get married at all!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, wait! Emily! No, wait, stop! Emily, please—

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: So, did shopping make you feel any better about Ross?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Manhattan does not have enough stores.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, I think I can help you get over him.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You can?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah. I just need you to bring me some photos of Ross.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Um-hmm.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: And a small piece of chocolate.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: And a glass of tepid water.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ooh, is this one of those things where you throw it in a bag with some graveyard dirt and hang it from a north-facing tree?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Uh, only if you have the hiccups too. Yeah, the pictures are for you, the water and the chocolate is for me. I just didn’t feel like getting up. Okay, I’m gonna show you a picture of Ross. Okay? And you’re going to remember all of the bad things about him. All right? Really focus on his flaws.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I can do that. I certainly did it when we were going out.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay. Umm, before we get started, I just wanna say for the record that I love Ross, I think he’s such a great guy. Here. Okay, now, close your eyes. And imagine that you’re with Ross okay and imagine that you’re kissing him. And you’re-you’re running your hands all over his body. And then you run your hands through his hair, but eew-oh gross it’s some kind of grease, it’s—uck! Hah?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I don’t know, his uh, his hair never really bothered me that much, and y’know it was always more crunchy than it was greasy.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, this is going to be harder than I thought. Umm, let’s try some uh, aversion therapy.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: So uh, now look at the picture…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: All right, and umm…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ow!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, how do you feel now?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, I like you less!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh. Sorry!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No-no-no, y’know what? I really shouldn’t have said that you were embarrassing me, I mean that really wasn’t cool. And if it makes you feel any better, I’ve had a really lousy day.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Me too.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Noo!! I’ve had the best day ever! Dude, check this out!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Sh-shh-shh!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay, so say hi to my friend and tell him that you like the hat.

utterance.speaker: Fergie
utterance.content: Okay, so umm, what’s your friend’s name?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, Chandler.

utterance.speaker: Fergie
utterance.content: Hi Chandler!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That’s… That’s was…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That’s Fergie baby!!

utterance.speaker: Fergie
utterance.content: Joey says you don’t really like his hat, but I think it’s kinda dashing.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: How did you? How? How?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, I was trying to figure out how to get to Buckingham Palace, right? So, I’m in my map and-and… Hey!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hi. I understand you had a little talk with Emily.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yes, I did! And you are welcome!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Am I?! And was it your idea to postpone the wedding?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Umm…

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’m gonna go to the bathroom.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Wait up!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey-hey, since you’re the ‘fix-it’ lady, here’s a pickle, what do you do when the bride says she doesn’t want to have the wedding at all?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: She said that?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Why?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I don’t know, I told her it was stupid to put off the wedding just because the hall was gone and she liked flipped out.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my God. You’re even dumber than I am!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ross, how long have you been planning this wedding?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I don’t know. A month?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Emily has probably been planning it since she was five! Ever since the first time she took a pillowcase and hung it off the back of her head. That’s what we did! We dreamed about the perfect wedding, and the perfect place, with the perfect four-tiered wedding cake , with the little people on top. Thanks. But the most important part is that we had the perfect guy who understood just how important all that other stuff was.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I had no idea. And that-that pillowcase thing, I thought you guys were just doing the flying nun.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Sometimes we were.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Come on. You gotta help me figure out what to do. Okay?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Come on.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That was pretty intense huh?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah. Hey, I hope Ross didn’t think that we just went in there because we were uncomfortable being out here!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I hope he did!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, Pheebs! It’s Joey!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey, Joey! Hey! Ooh! Ooh! I just say someone on the—that looks just like you on the subway. And I was gonna go over and say ‘hi!’ but then I figured, he doesn’t care if he looks like you.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That just cost me four bucks. But uh listen, I just called to see how the chick and the duck are doing?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ohh, they’re having a great time with their Aunt Phoebe! Aunt Rachel hasn’t been helpful at all. So, do you miss me?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Kinda, but I’ve just been having way too much fun.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: So you’re not homesick yet?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No, I don’t think so.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: All right, the seven of us miss you.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Who’s seven?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Y’know, me, Rachel, the birds, the babies…

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ahh, the babies miss me?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ooh, the pizza guy’s here!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What? You ordered pizza without me?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah. But y’know we were thinking about you, y’know we ordered the Joey Special.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Two pizzas?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yep! Okay, gotta go, talk to you later.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Wait, well, where did you get it from?!

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Monica, why have you brought me here of all places?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You’ll see.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: I tell you, this wedding is not going to happen.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Oh God.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay? But-but imagine a lot more lights, okay? And-and y’know fewer bricks, and-and-and flowers, and candles…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: And the musicians, look, they can go over here , okay? And the chairs can face this way , and… You go.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: But-but, if you don’t love this, we’ll do it in any other place at any other time. Really, it’s fine, whatever you want.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: It’s perfect.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: And, I don’t know, if it starts to rain…

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Well then we’ll get wet.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ohh. And I don’t even have a date.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Pheebs?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Do you remember where the duck food is?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s in the guys’ apartment under the sink. Why?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Because I’m going to London.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What?! What do you mean you’re going to London?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, I have to tell Ross that I love him. Now honey, you take care, you don’t have those babies until I get back.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I—Rachel, you can’t go! Ross loves Emily!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, I know, I know, I know he does. But I have to tell him how I feel! He deserves to have all the information and then he can make an informed decision.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: That’s not why you’re going! You’re going because you hope he’s gonna say, "Yeah, I love you too, Rach. Forget that British chippy."

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohh—Do you think he will?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No! Because he’s in love with the British chippy! Look, Rachel, if you go, you’re just gonna mess with his head and ruin his wedding! Y’know, it’s too late! You missed you’re chance! I’m sorry, I know this must be really hard, it’s over.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Y’know what? No. It’s not over until someone says, "I do."

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I do! I do! I do! I do! Ugh, like I can really chase you. I’m carrying a litter.
